message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with modeling event-related potentials (ERPs) collected during reading using language models. Additionally, the use of contextual word embeddings and surprisal-based models suggests a focus on natural language processing. 

It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the paper proposes a novel framework for modeling ERPs using pre-trained convolutional decoders and language models. 

cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is another possible sub-category as the paper deals with neural models for decoding ERPs. 

cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely sub-category as the paper proposes a framework for modeling ERPs that involves machine learning and natural language processing techniques. 

Finally, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is a less likely sub-category as the paper does not explicitly deal with visual data, but the use of convolutional decoders could suggest a focus on image processing.
